raw_response:

      "source": "https://pitchbook.com/profiles/company/151213-33"
    },
    {

      "ticker": "KYMR",

      "market_cap_usd_b": "0.7",

  "selection_methodology": "Targets were selected based on (1) strategic relevance to large biopharma acquirers, (2) pipeline maturity and modality/platform fit, (3) market cap and public trading status, and (4) recent M&A trends in biotech. Tier 1 targets are larger, more mature, and have higher strategic fit; Tier 2 targets are earlier-stage or have more niche platforms.",
  "source_urls": [
    "https://www.genengnews.com/a-lists/top-25-biotech-companies-heading-into-2026/",

  "reasoning_steps": [
    "Step 1: Screened the universe of U.S.-listed biotech companies for strategic relevance, focusing on companies with advanced pipelines, novel modalities, or platform technologies attractive to large biopharma acquirers.",
    "Step 2: Assigned Tier 1 status to companies with (a) market caps between $2B and $50B, (b) late-stage or commercial assets, and (c) high strategic fit (e.g., RNAi, gene editing, cell therapy, protein degradation).",
    "Step 3: Assigned Tier 2 status to companies with (a) market caps below $2B, (b) earlier-stage pipelines, or (c) more niche or high-risk platforms (e.g., TIL therapy, oncolytic immunotherapy, AI-driven gene therapy).",
    "Step 4: Verified market caps using public sources and cross-checked for consistency."

tier_1_targets.name: Alnylam Pharmaceuticals
tier_1_targets.strategic_rationale: Leader in RNAi therapeutics with a robust pipeline in genetic medicines, rare diseases, and cardiometabolic indications. Strategic fit for large pharma seeking to bolster RNA-based platforms.

tier_1_targets.name: Sarepta Therapeutics
tier_1_targets.strategic_rationale: Dominant player in Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) with a growing gene therapy pipeline. Attractive for acquirers seeking leadership in rare genetic diseases.

tier_1_targets.strategic_rationale: Pioneer in base editing, a next-generation CRISPR modality. Strategic fit for large biopharma aiming to lead in precision genetic medicine.

tier_1_targets.name: Arcellx
tier_1_targets.strategic_rationale: Innovator in novel CAR-T and adaptive cell therapies, with a platform that could enhance existing cell therapy franchises.

tier_1_targets.name: Kymera Therapeutics
tier_1_targets.strategic_rationale: Leader in targeted protein degradation, a high-potential modality for oncology and immune-mediated diseases. Strong platform fit for large biopharma.

tier_2_targets.name: Iovance Biotherapeutics

tier_2_targets.name: Arvinas

tier_2_targets.name: Replimune

tier_2_targets.name: Dyno Therapeutics
tier_2_targets.strategic_rationale: AI-driven AAV vector engineering for gene therapy. High-value platform for acquirers seeking to optimize gene delivery and reduce immunogenicity.

parsed_response.selection_methodology: Targets were selected based on (1) strategic relevance to large biopharma acquirers, (2) pipeline maturity and modality/platform fit, (3) market cap and public trading status, and (4) recent M&A trends in biotech. Tier 1 targets are larger, more mature, and have higher strategic fit; Tier 2 targets are earlier-stage or have more niche platforms.
reasoning_steps: Step 1: Screened the universe of U.S.-listed biotech companies for strategic relevance, focusing on companies with advanced pipelines, novel modalities, or platform technologies attractive to large biopharma acquirers.

Step 2: Assigned Tier 1 status to companies with (a) market caps between $2B and $50B, (b) late-stage or commercial assets, and (c) high strategic fit (e.g., RNAi, gene editing, cell therapy, protein degradation).

Step 3: Assigned Tier 2 status to companies with (a) market caps below $2B, (b) earlier-stage pipelines, or (c) more niche or high-risk platforms (e.g., TIL therapy, oncolytic immunotherapy, AI-driven gene therapy).
Step 4: Verified market caps using public sources and cross-checked for consistency.
